article:
, 2004).]] An 'outlet store' or 'factory outlet' is a brick and mortar or online
retail store in which manufacturers sell their stock directly to the public.
Traditionally, a factory outlet was a store attached to a factory or warehouse,
sometimes allowing customers to watch the production process like in the
original L.L. Bean store. In modern usage, outlet stores are typically manufacturer-
branded stores like Gap or Bon Worth grouped together in outlet malls. The
invention of the factory outlet store is often credited to Harold Alfond,
founder of the Dexter Shoe Company.
